   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   23:          ex1/1]).

   29:          handle_info/2,code_change/3]).

   34:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   35:      {timetrap,{minutes,5}}].

   38:     [ex1].

   43: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   44:     Config.
   45: 
   46: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   47:     ok.

   57: -define(DEBUG(X),debug_disabled).
   58: %%-define(DEBUG(X),X).
   59: -define(GLOBAL_PARAMS,ets_tough_SUITE_global_params).
   60: 
   61: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   65:     ets:delete(?GLOBAL_PARAMS).
   66: 
   67: 
   68: ex1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   69:     ets:new(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,[named_table,public]),
   70:     ets:insert(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,{a,set}),
   71:     ets:insert(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,{b,set}),
   72:     ex1_sub(Config),
   73:     ets:insert(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,{a,ordered_set}),
   74:     ets:insert(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,{b,set}),
   75:     ex1_sub(Config),
   76:     ets:insert(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,{a,ordered_set}),
   77:     ets:insert(?GLOBAL_PARAMS,{b,ordered_set}),
   78:     ex1_sub(Config).
   79: 
   80: 
   81: 
   82: 
   83: ex1_sub(Config) ->
   84:     {A,B} = prep(Config),
   85:     N = 
   86: 	case proplists:get_value(ets_tough_SUITE_iters,Config) of
   87: 	    undefined ->
   88: 		5000;
   89: 	    Other -> 
   90: 		Other
   91: 	end,
   92:     {NewA,NewB} = run({A,B},N),
   93:     _Gurkor = lists:keysearch(gurka,1,ets:all()),
   94:     (catch stop(NewA)),
   95:     (catch stop(NewB)),
   96:     ok.
   97: 
   98: prep(Config) ->
   99:     rand:seed(exsplus),
  100:     put(dump_ticket,none),
  101:     DumpDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config), "ets_tough"),
  102:     file:make_dir(DumpDir),
  103:     put(dump_dir,DumpDir),
  104:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  105:     {ok, A} = start(a),
  106:     {ok, B} = start(b),
  107:     {A,B}.
  108: 
  109: run({A,B},N) ->
  110:     run(A,B,0,N).
  111: 
  112: run(A,B,N,N) ->
  113:     {A,B};
  114: run(A,B,N,M) ->
  115:     eat_msgs(),
  116:     Op = random_operation(),
  117:     ?DEBUG(io:format("~w: ",[N])),
  118:     case catch operate(Op,A,B) of
  119: 	{'EXIT',Reason} ->
  120: 	    io:format("\nFAILURE on ~w: ~w, reason: ~w\n",[N,Op,Reason]),
  121: 	    exit(failed);
  122: 	{new_a,NewA} ->
  123: 	    run(NewA,B,N+1,M);
  124: 	_ ->
  125: 	    run(A,B,N+1,M)
  126:     end.
  127: 
  128: eat_msgs() ->
  129:     receive
  130: 	_Anything ->
  131: 	    eat_msgs()
  132:     after 0 ->
  133: 	    ok
  134:     end.
  135: 
  136: operate(get,A,B) ->
  137:     case random_key() of
  138: 	1 ->
  139: 	    Class = random_class(),
  140: 	    AnsA = lists:sort(dget_class(A,Class,all)),
  141: 	    AnsB = lists:sort(dget_class(B,Class,all)),
  142: 	    ?DEBUG(io:format("get_class ~w (~w)\n",[Class,AnsA])),
  143: 	    AnsA = AnsB;
  144: 	_Other ->
  145: 	    Class = random_class(),
  146: 	    Key = random_key(),
  147: 	    AnsA = dget(A,Class,Key),
  148: 	    AnsB = dget(B,Class,Key),
  149: 	    ?DEBUG(io:format("get ~w,~w (~w)\n",[Class,Key,AnsA])),
  150: 	    AnsA = AnsB
  151:     end;
  152: 
  153: operate(put,A,B) ->
  154:     Class = random_class(),
  155:     Key = random_key(),
  156:     Value = random_value(),
  157:     AnsA = dput(A,Class,Key,Value),
  158:     AnsB = dput(B,Class,Key,Value),
  159:     ?DEBUG(io:format("put ~w,~w=~w (~w)\n",[Class,Key,Value,AnsA])),
  160:     AnsA = AnsB;
  161: 
  162: operate(erase,A,B) ->
  163:     case random_key() of
  164: 	1 ->
  165: 	    Class = random_class(),
  166: 	    AnsA = derase_class(A,Class),
  167: 	    AnsB = derase_class(B,Class),
  168: 	    ?DEBUG(io:format("erase_class ~w\n",[Class])),
  169: 	    AnsA = AnsB;
  170: 	_Other ->
  171: 	    Class = random_class(),
  172: 	    Key = random_key(),
  173: 	    AnsA = derase(A,Class,Key),
  174: 	    AnsB = derase(B,Class,Key),
  175: 	    ?DEBUG(io:format("erase ~w,~w (~w)\n",[Class,Key,AnsA])),
  176: 	    AnsA = AnsB
  177:     end;
  178: 
  179: operate(dirty_get,A,_B) ->
  180:     Class = random_class(),
  181:     Key = random_key(),
  182:     %% only try dirty get on the b-side (which is never dumping)
  183:     AnsA = dget(A,Class,Key),
  184:     AnsB = dirty_dget(b,Class,Key),
  185:     ?DEBUG(io:format("dirty_get ~w,~w (~w)\n",[Class,Key,AnsA])),
  186:     AnsA = AnsB;
  187: 
  188: operate(dump,A,_B) ->
  189:     case get(dump_ticket) of
  190: 	{dump_more,Ticket} ->
  191: 	    Units = random_key(),
  192: 	    NewTicket = ddump_next(A,Units,Ticket),
  193: 	    put(dump_ticket,NewTicket),
  194: 	    _Result = case NewTicket of
  195: 			  done -> done;
  196: 			  _ ->    dump_more
  197: 		      end,
  198: 	    ?DEBUG(io:format("dump ~w (~w)\n",[Units,_Result]));
  199: 	_ ->
  200: 	    DumpDir = get(dump_dir),
  201: 	    case random_key() of
  202: 		1 ->
  203: 		    ?DEBUG(io:format("start_dump\n",[])),
  204: 		    NewTicket = ddump_first(A,DumpDir),
  205: 		    put(dump_ticket,NewTicket);
  206: 		2 ->
  207: 		    ?DEBUG(io:format("dump_and_restore\n",[])),
  208: 		    {dump_more,NewTicket} = ddump_first(A,DumpDir),
  209: 		    done = ddump_next(A,1000000,NewTicket),
  210: 		    stop(A),
  211: 		    {ok, NewA} = start(a,DumpDir),
  212: 		    {new_a,NewA};
  213: 		_ ->
  214: 		    ?DEBUG(io:format("idle\n",[])),
  215: 		    ok
  216: 	    end
  217:     end.
  218: 
  219: random_operation() ->
  220:     Ops = {get,put,erase,dirty_get,dump},
  221:     random_element(Ops).
  222: 
  223: random_class() ->
  224:     Classes = {foo,bar,tomat,gurka},
  225:     random_element(Classes).
  226: 
  227: random_key() ->
  228:     rand:uniform(8).
  229: 
  230: random_value() ->
  231:     case rand:uniform(5) of
  232: 	1 -> ok;
  233: 	2 -> {data,random_key()};
  234: 	3 -> {foo,bar,random_class()};
  235: 	4 -> rand:uniform(1000);
  236: 	5 -> {recursive,random_value()}
  237:     end.
  238: 
  239: random_element(T) ->
  240:     I = rand:uniform(tuple_size(T)),
  241:     element(I,T).
  242:

  244: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

  246: %%% DEFINITIONS %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  247: 
  248: -define(NAMED_TABLES,true).
  249: -define(DB_NAME_KEY, {'$db_name'}).
  250: -define(LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY,{'$list_of_classes'}).
  251: -define(DUMPING_FLAG_KEY,{'$dumping_flag'}).
  252: -define(DUMP_DIRECTORY_KEY,{'$dump_directory'}).
  253: -define(ERASE_MARK(Key),{{{'$erased'},Key}}).
  254: -define(ets_new,ets:new).
  255: -define(ets_lookup,ets:lookup).
  256: -define(ets_insert,ets:insert).    % erlang:db_put
  257: -define(ets_delete,ets:delete).    % erlang:db_erase
  258: -define(ets_first,ets:first).      % erlang:db_first
  259: -define(ets_next,ets:next).        % erlang:db_next_key
  260: -define(ets_info,ets:info).        % erlang:db_info
  261: 
  262: %%% INTERFACE FUNCTIONS %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  263: 
  264: %%% start(DbName) -> Pid | {error,Reason}
  265: %%%
  266: %%% Starts the ets table database with name DbName
  267: 
  268: start(DbName) ->
  269:     case gen_server:start_link(ets_tough_SUITE,{DbName,no_dump_dir},[]) of
  270: 	{ok,Pid} when is_pid(Pid) ->
  271: 	    {ok, Pid};
  272: 	Other ->
  273: 	    Other
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: %%% start(DbName,DumpDir) -> Pid | {error,Reason}
  277: %%%
  278: %%% Starts the ets table database with name DbName, and reads a dump
  279: %%% from DumpDir when it starts.
  280: 
  281: start(DbName,DumpDir) ->
  282:     case gen_server:start_link(ets_tough_SUITE,
  283: 			       {DbName,{dump_dir,DumpDir}},[]) of
  284: 	{ok,Pid} when is_pid(Pid) ->
  285: 	    {ok, Pid};
  286: 	Other ->
  287: 	    Other
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: %%% stop(ServerPid) -> {'EXIT',shutdown}
  291: %%%
  292: %%% Shuts down the ets table database
  293: 
  294: stop(ServerPid) ->
  295:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,stop).
  296: 
  297: %%% dget(ServerPid,Class,Key) -> {value,Value} | undefined
  298: %%%
  299: %%% Returns a value identified by Class,Key from the database, or
  300: %%% 'undefined' if there is no such value.
  301: 
  302: dget(ServerPid,Class,Key) ->
  303:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,{handle_lookup,Class,Key}).
  304: 
  305: %%% dirty_dget(DbName,Class,Key) -> {value,Value} | undefined
  306: %%%
  307: %%% This is looks up the value directly in the ets table
  308: %%% to avoid message passing. Several databases may be started,
  309: %%% so the admin table must be registered.
  310: 
  311: dirty_dget(DbName,Class,Key) ->
  312:     Admin = admin_table_name(DbName),
  313:     case catch(?ets_lookup(Admin,Class)) of
  314: 	[{_Class,[Tab|_Tabs]}] ->
  315: 	    case ?ets_lookup(Tab,Key) of
  316: 		[{_Key,Value}] ->
  317: 		    {value,Value};
  318: 		_ ->
  319: 		    undefined
  320: 	    end;
  321: 	_ ->
  322: 	    undefined
  323:     end.
  324: 
  325: %%% dput(ServerPid,Class,Key,Value) -> undefined | {value,OldValue}
  326: %%%
  327: %%% Inserts the given Value to be identified by Class,Key. Any prevoius
  328: %%% value is returned, or otherwise 'undefined'.
  329: 
  330: dput(ServerPid,Class,Key,Value) ->
  331:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,{handle_insert,Class,Key,Value}).
  332: 
  333: %%% derase(ServerPid,Class,Key) -> undefined | {value,OldValue}
  334: %%%
  335: %%% Erases any value identified by Class,Key
  336: 
  337: derase(ServerPid,Class,Key) ->
  338:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,{handle_delete,Class,Key}).
  339: 
  340: %%% dget_class(ServerPid,Class,Condition) -> KeyList
  341: %%%
  342: %%% Returns a list of keys where the instance match Condition.
  343: %%% Condition = 'all' returns all keys in the class.
  344: %%% The condition is supplied as Condition = {Mod, Fun, ExtraArgs},
  345: %%% where the instance will be prepended to ExtraArgs before each
  346: %%% call is made.
  347: 
  348: dget_class(ServerPid,Class,Condition) ->
  349:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,
  350: 		    {handle_get_class,Class,Condition},infinity).
  351: 
  352: %%% derase_class(ServerPid,Class) -> ok
  353: %%%
  354: %%% Erases a whole class, identified by Class
  355: 
  356: derase_class(ServerPid,Class) ->
  357:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,{handle_delete_class,Class}, infinity).
  358: 
  359: %%% ddump_first(ServerPid,DumpDir) -> {dump_more,Ticket} | already_dumping
  360: %%%
  361: %%% Starts dumping the database. This call redirects all database updates
  362: %%% to temporary tables, so that exactly the same database image will be
  363: %%% written to disk as is in memory when this function is called.
  364: %%% The returned Ticket is to be used with ddump_next/2
  365: 
  366: ddump_first(ServerPid,DumpDir) ->
  367:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,{handle_dump_first,DumpDir}, infinity).
  368: 
  369: %%% ddump_next(ServerPid,Count,Ticket) -> {dump_more,Ticket} | done
  370: %%%
  371: %%% Dumps the database. This function performs Count units of dump work.
  372: %%% Higher value of Count makes the entire dump operation more efficient,
  373: %%% but blocks the database for longer periods of time.
  374: %%% If there is still more work to be done, a new Ticket is returned,
  375: %%% or 'done' otherwise.
  376: 
  377: ddump_next(ServerPid,Count,Ticket) ->
  378:     gen_server:call(ServerPid,{handle_dump_next,Ticket,Count},150000).
  379: 
  380: %%% PRIVATE HANDLER FUNCTIONS %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  381: 
  382: %%% Admin
  383: %%% -----
  384: %%%
  385: %%% The database has a main administrative table Admin. It always contains
  386: %%% these four items:
  387: %%%
  388: %%%    {{'$db_name'},Name}
  389: %%%    {{'$list_of_classes'},ListOfClasses}
  390: %%%    {{'$dumping_flag'},BoolDumping}
  391: %%%    {{'$dump_directory'},Dir}
  392: %%%
  393: %%% The ListOfClasses is simply a list of all Classes that has ever been
  394: %%% inserted in the database. It's used to know which tables to dump.
  395: %%% The dump flag is 'true' while dump is in progress, to make it
  396: %%% impossible to start a new dump before an old dump is completed.
  397: %%%
  398: %%% For each class there is an entry of the form
  399: %%%
  400: %%%    {Class,ListOfTables}
  401: %%%
  402: %%% Where the ListOfTables is the list of class tables (see below)
  403: %%%
  404: %%% Class Tables
  405: %%% ------------
  406: %%%
  407: %%% The class tables are common ets tables that have the actual user
  408: %%% data stored in them.
  409: %%%
  410: %%% Normally there is only one class table, Mtab (main table).
  411: %%% When dumping is initiated, each class is syncronously given a 
  412: %%% temporary table, Ttab, where all updates are stored. Reads are 
  413: %%% directed to the Ttab first, and only if not found there, Mtab is
  414: %%% consulted.
  415: %%%
  416: %%% Writes always go to the first table in the table sequence. This
  417: %%% ensures that the dump algorithm can enumerate the entries in the
  418: %%% other tables, without risk of being disrupted.
  419: %%%
  420: %%% When the dumping to disk is completed, it's time to write back
  421: %%% whatever updates that came into the Ttab to Mtab. To do this, a
  422: %%% third table is needed, Utab, to handle all updates while Ttab is
  423: %%% being copied to Mtab. When all of Ttab is copied, Ttab is thrown
  424: %%% away, and the whole process is repeated with Utab as Ttab until
  425: %%% eventually nobody wrote to Utab while Ttab was copied (clean run).
  426: %%%
  427: %%% There is no _guarantee_ that this will ever happen, but unless there
  428: %%% is a constant (and quite high frequency) stream of updates to a
  429: %%% particular class, this should work.
  430: %%%
  431: %%% (It is possible to make this failsafe, by copying the elements in
  432: %%% Mtab to Ttab. This is probably a lot more expensive, though)
  433: %%%
  434: %%% Erasure during dump
  435: %%% -------------------
  436: %%%
  437: %%% Erasing need special attention when a single class has several 
  438: %%% tables. It really boils down to a number of cases:
  439: %%% 
  440: %%% - element does not exist in Ttab.
  441: %%%     A special erase record is written, {{{'$erased'},Key}} which
  442: %%%     is hopefully different from all other keys used by the user.
  443: %%% - element exists in Ttab
  444: %%%     The element is deleted, and erase record is written
  445: %%% - element does not exist in Ttab, but there is an erase record
  446: %%%     fine, do nothing
  447: %%% - element exist in Ttab, and there is an erase record
  448: %%%     This happens when a record is deleted from Ttab, then written
  449: %%%     back again. Erase records are not looked for when inserting
  450: %%%     new data (and that's not necessary)
  451: %%%
  452: %%% Then when Ttab should be copied to Mtab:
  453: %%%
  454: %%% - found an element
  455: %%%     Usual case, just copy
  456: %%% - found erase record
  457: %%%     Check if there is an element with the same key as the erase
  458: %%%     record. If so it has been written later than the erasure, so
  459: %%%     the erasure is obsolete. Otherwise erase the record from Mtab.
  460: %%%
  461: %%% Delete Class
  462: %%% ------------
  463: %%%
  464: %%% A slight problem is deleting an entire class while dumping is in
  465: %%% progress. For consitency, all user visible traces of the class must
  466: %%% be deleted, while dumping must not be affected. On top of that, the
  467: %%% deleted class may well be recreated while dumping is still going on,
  468: %%% and entries added.
  469: %%%
  470: %%% This is solved by having the dump algorithm keep track of the table
  471: %%% identifiers of the tables to dump, rather than asking the admin table
  472: %%% (since the class might be deleted there). The dump algorithm will
  473: %%% itself take care of deleting the tables used in the dumping, while the
  474: %%% normal database interface deletes the "first table", the table that is
  475: %%% currently accepting all write operations.
  476: 
  477: 
  478: init({DbName,DumpDir}) ->
  479:     case DumpDir of
  480: 	no_dump_dir ->
  481: 	    Admin = make_admin_table(DbName),
  482: 	    ?ets_insert(Admin,{?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY,[]}),
  483: 	    init2(DbName,Admin);
  484: 	{dump_dir,Dir} ->
  485: 	    case load_dump(DbName,Dir) of
  486: 		{ok,Admin} ->
  487: 		    ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DUMP_DIRECTORY_KEY,Dir}),
  488: 		    init2(DbName,Admin);
  489: 		_ ->
  490: 		    cant_load_dump
  491: 	    end
  492:     end.
  493: 
  494: init2(DbName,Admin) ->
  495:     ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DUMPING_FLAG_KEY,false}),
  496:     ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DB_NAME_KEY,DbName}),
  497:     {ok, Admin}.
  498: 
  499: terminate(_Reason,_Admin) ->
  500:     ok.
  501: 
  502: handle_call({handle_lookup,Class,Key},_From,Admin) ->
  503:     %% Lookup tables to search in
  504:     Reply =
  505: 	case ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class) of
  506: 	    [] ->
  507: 		undefined; %% no such class => no such record
  508: 	    [{_,TabList}] ->
  509: 		{_,Ans} = table_lookup(TabList, Key),
  510: 		Ans
  511: 	end,
  512:     {reply,Reply,Admin};
  513: 
  514: handle_call({handle_insert,Class,Key,Value},_From,Admin) ->
  515:     %% Lookup in which table to write
  516:     Reply = 
  517: 	case ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class) of
  518: 	    [] ->
  519: 		%% undefined class, let's create it
  520: 		Mtab = make_db_table(db_name(Admin),Class),
  521: 		?ets_insert(Admin,{Class,[Mtab]}),
  522: 		[{_,Classes}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin,?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY),
  523: 		?ets_insert(Admin,{?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY,[Class|Classes]}),
  524: 		?ets_insert(Mtab, {Key, Value}),
  525: 		undefined;
  526: 	    [{_,[Tab|Tabs]}] ->
  527: 		{_,Old} = table_lookup([Tab|Tabs], Key),
  528: 		?ets_insert(Tab, {Key, Value}),
  529: 		Old
  530: 	end,
  531:     {reply,Reply,Admin};
  532: 
  533: handle_call({handle_delete,Class,Key},_From,Admin) ->
  534:     %% Lookup in which table to write
  535:     Reply =
  536: 	case ?ets_lookup(Admin, Class) of
  537: 	    [] ->
  538: 		undefined; %% no such class, but delete is happy anyway
  539: 	    [{_,[Tab]}] ->
  540: 		%% When there is only one table, simply deleting is enough
  541: 		{_,Old} = table_lookup(Tab,Key),
  542: 		?ets_delete(Tab,Key),
  543: 		Old;
  544: 	    [{_,[Tab|Tabs]}] ->
  545: 		%% When there are more tables, we have to write a delete
  546: 		%% record into the first one, so that nobody goes looking
  547: 		%% for this entry in some other table
  548: 		{_,Old} = table_lookup([Tab|Tabs],Key),
  549: 		?ets_insert(Tab, {?ERASE_MARK(Key), erased}),
  550: 		?ets_delete(Tab,Key),
  551: 		Old
  552: 	end,
  553:     {reply,Reply,Admin};
  554: 
  555: handle_call({handle_get_class,Class,Cond},_From,Admin) ->
  556:     Reply =
  557: 	case ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class) of     % Lookup tables to search in
  558: 	    [] ->
  559: 		[];          % no such class
  560: 	    [{_,TabList}] ->
  561: 		table_lookup_batch(TabList, Class, Cond)  % get class data
  562: 	end,
  563:     {reply,Reply,Admin};
  564: 
  565: handle_call({handle_delete_class,Class},_From,Admin) ->
  566:     Reply =
  567: 	case ?ets_lookup(Admin, Class) of
  568: 	    [] ->
  569: 		ok;     % no such class, but delete_class is happy anyway
  570: 	    [{_,[Tab|_Tabs]}] ->
  571: 		%% Always delete the first table (the one we're writing into)
  572: 		%% In case we're dumping, the rest of the tables will be
  573: 		%% taken care of by the dump algorithm.
  574: 		?ets_delete(Tab),
  575: 		[{_, Classes}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin, ?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY),
  576: 		NewClasses = lists:delete(Class, Classes),
  577: 		?ets_insert(Admin, {?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY, NewClasses}),
  578: 		?ets_delete(Admin, Class),
  579: 		ok
  580: 	end,
  581:     {reply,Reply,Admin};
  582: 
  583: handle_call({handle_dmodify,Application},_From,Admin) ->
  584:     [{_, Classes}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin, ?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY),
  585:     modify(Application, Classes, Admin),
  586:     {reply,ok,Admin};
  587: 
  588: handle_call({handle_dump_first,DumpDir},_From,Admin) ->
  589:     case ?ets_lookup(Admin,?DUMPING_FLAG_KEY) of
  590: 	[{_,true}] ->
  591: 	    {reply,already_dumping,Admin};
  592: 	_ ->
  593: 	    phys_remove_ok(DumpDir),
  594: 	    [{_,Classes}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin,?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY),
  595: 	    Tables = dump_prepare_classes(Classes,Admin),
  596: 	    ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DUMPING_FLAG_KEY,true}),
  597: 	    %% this is the new dir for dumping:
  598: 	    ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DUMP_DIRECTORY_KEY,DumpDir}),
  599: 	    handle_dump_next({[{admin,Classes}|Tables]},0,Admin)
  600:     end;
  601: 
  602: %% All done, good work!
  603: handle_call({handle_dump_next,Ticket,Count},_From,Admin) ->
  604:     handle_dump_next(Ticket,Count,Admin);
  605: 
  606: handle_call(stop,_From,Admin) ->
  607:     ?ets_delete(Admin), % Make sure table is gone before reply is sent.
  608:     {stop, normal, ok, []}.
  609: 
  610: handle_cast(_Req, Admin) ->
  611:     {noreply, Admin}.
  612: 
  613: handle_info({'EXIT',_Pid,_Reason},Admin) ->
  614:     {stop,normal,Admin}.
  615: 
  616: code_change(_OldVsn, StateData, _Extra) ->
  617:     {ok, StateData}.
  618: 
  619: handle_delete(Class, Key, Admin) ->
  620:     handle_call({handle_delete,Class,Key},from,Admin).
  621: 
  622: handle_insert(Class, Key, Value, Admin) ->
  623:     handle_call({handle_insert,Class,Key,Value},from,Admin).
  624: 
  625: handle_lookup(Class, Key, Admin) ->
  626:     handle_call({handle_lookup,Class,Key},from,Admin).
  627: 
  628: 
  629: handle_dump_next({[]},_Count,Admin) ->
  630:     [{_Key,DumpDir}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin,?DUMP_DIRECTORY_KEY),
  631:     phys_ok_dump(DumpDir),
  632:     ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DUMPING_FLAG_KEY,false}),
  633:     {reply,done,Admin};
  634: 
  635: %% No more operations, return to user asking for more
  636: handle_dump_next(Ticket,0,Admin) ->
  637:     {reply,{dump_more,Ticket},Admin};
  638: 
  639: %% Dump the admin table. Costs one dump-work unit.
  640: handle_dump_next({[{admin,Classes}|Tables]},Count,Admin) ->
  641:     [{_Key,DumpDir}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin,?DUMP_DIRECTORY_KEY),
  642:     DumpData = phys_init_dump(admin,DumpDir,0),
  643:     phys_dump({?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY,Classes},DumpData),
  644:     phys_finish_dump(DumpData),
  645:     handle_dump_next({Tables},Count-1,Admin);
  646: 
  647: %% Pick out a class and start dumping it
  648: handle_dump_next({[{Class,Mtab}|Tables]},Count,Admin) ->
  649:     ?DEBUG(io:format("DUMP CLASS ~w\n",[Class])),
  650:     [{_Key,DumpDir}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin,?DUMP_DIRECTORY_KEY),
  651:     DumpData = phys_init_dump(Class,DumpDir,length(Tables)+1),
  652:     First = ?ets_first(Mtab),
  653:     handle_dump_next({Class,Tables,Mtab,First,DumpData},Count,Admin);
  654: 
  655: %% All keys in this class have been written to disk, now we have to
  656: %% copy all items from temporary Ttab to main Mtab
  657: handle_dump_next({Class,Tables,Stab,'$end_of_table',DumpData},Count,Admin) ->
  658:     phys_finish_dump(DumpData),
  659:     ?DEBUG(io:format("Cleaning up temporary table in ~p\n",[Class])),
  660:     case ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class) of
  661: 	[{Key,[Utab,Mtab]}] ->
  662: 	    Ttab = make_db_table(db_name(Admin),Class),
  663: 	    ?ets_insert(Admin,{Key,[Ttab,Utab,Mtab]}),
  664: 	    First = ?ets_first(Utab),
  665: 	    handle_dump_next({3,Class,Tables,Utab,First,Mtab},Count,Admin);
  666: 	_Other ->
  667: 	    %% Class deleted (and maybe recreated) while dumping, no need to 
  668: 	    %% bring this one up to date. Just discard late additions.
  669: 	    ?ets_delete(Stab),
  670: 	    handle_dump_next({Tables},Count,Admin)
  671:     end;
  672: 
  673: %% Dumping one key to disk. Costs one dump-work unit.
  674: handle_dump_next({Class,Tables,Tab,Key,DumpData},Count,Admin) ->
  675:     [KeyVal] = ?ets_lookup(Tab,Key),
  676:     phys_dump(KeyVal,DumpData),
  677:     NextKey = ?ets_next(Tab,Key),
  678:     handle_dump_next({Class,Tables,Tab,NextKey,DumpData},Count-1,Admin);
  679: 
  680: %% Done copying elements from Ttab to Mtab
  681: %% check if Utab is empty and go on with next class, or
  682: %% make Utab the current Ttab, and run again
  683: %% ... will this ever end? ;-)
  684: handle_dump_next({3,Class,Tables,Stab,'$end_of_table',Dtab},Count,Admin) ->
  685:     case ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class) of
  686: 	[{Key,[Ttab,Utab,Mtab]}] ->
  687: 	    case ?ets_info(Ttab,size) of
  688: 		0 ->
  689: 		    ?ets_insert(Admin,{Key,[Mtab]}),
  690: 		    ?ets_delete(Ttab),
  691: 		    ?ets_delete(Utab),
  692: 		    handle_dump_next({Tables},Count,Admin);
  693: 		_Work ->
  694: 		    ?DEBUG(io:format("Switching direction in ~p\n",[Class])),
  695: 		    %% Which is faster, deleting all the entries
  696: 		    %% in a table, or deleting it and create a new?
  697: 		    ?ets_delete(Utab),
  698: 		    Ntab = make_db_table(db_name(Admin),Class),
  699: 		    ?ets_insert(Admin,{Key,[Ntab,Ttab,Mtab]}),
  700: 		    First = ?ets_first(Ttab),
  701: 		    handle_dump_next({3,Class,Tables,Ttab,First,Mtab},
  702: 				     Count,Admin)
  703: 	    end;
  704: 	_Other ->
  705: 	    %% Class deleted (and maybe recreated) while dumping, no need to 
  706: 	    %% bring this one up to date. Just discard late additions.
  707: 	    ?ets_delete(Stab),
  708: 	    ?ets_delete(Dtab),
  709: 	    handle_dump_next({Tables},Count,Admin)
  710:     end;
  711: 
  712: %% Copy one key from Ttab to Mtab
  713: %% costs one dump-work unit
  714: handle_dump_next({3,Class,Tables,Stab,Key,Dtab},Count,Admin) ->
  715:     copy_dump_entry(Stab,Key,Dtab),
  716:     NextKey = ?ets_next(Stab,Key),
  717:     handle_dump_next({3,Class,Tables,Stab,NextKey,Dtab},Count-1,Admin).
  718: 
  719: %%% INTERNAL HELPER FUNCTIONS %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  720: 
  721: %%% admin_table_name(DbName) -> Name
  722: %%%
  723: %%% Returns the name of the admin table of the table DbName
  724: 
  725: admin_table_name(DbName) ->
  726:     list_to_atom(lists:append(atom_to_list(DbName),"#admin")).
  727: 
  728: %%% make_admin_table(DbName) -> EtsAdminTable
  729: %%%
  730: %%% Creates and registers an ETS Admin table
  731: 
  732: make_admin_table(DbName) ->
  733:     ?ets_new(admin_table_name(DbName),[named_table,protected,db_type(DbName)]).
  734: 
  735: %%% make_db_table(DbName,Name) -> EtsTable
  736: %%%
  737: %%% Creates an ETS database table
  738: 
  739: make_db_table(DbName, Name) ->
  740:     ?ets_new(Name,[protected,db_type(DbName)]).
  741: 
  742: db_name(Admin) ->
  743:     ets:lookup_element(Admin,?DB_NAME_KEY,2).
  744: 
  745: db_type(DbName) ->
  746:     case ets:lookup(?GLOBAL_PARAMS, DbName) of
  747: 	[] ->
  748: 	    set;
  749: 	[{DbName,X}] ->
  750: 	    X
  751:     end.
  752: 
  753: %%% table_lookup(Table,Key) -> 
  754: %%% table_lookup(TableList,Key) ->
  755: %%%    {def,{value,Value}} | {undef,undefined} | (erased,undefined}
  756: %%%
  757: %%% Looks up key in the table and returns it value, or undefined
  758: %%% if there is no such key.
  759: %%% If a list of tables is given, they are searched one after another
  760: %%% for a matching key, until one is found. The search is discontinued
  761: %%% if a record telling that the key was deleted is found.
  762: 
  763: table_lookup([], _Key) ->
  764:     {undef,undefined};
  765: table_lookup([Table|Tables], Key) ->
  766:     case table_lookup(Table,Key) of
  767: 	{_,undefined} ->
  768: 	    case ?ets_lookup(Table,?ERASE_MARK(Key)) of
  769: 		[] ->
  770: 		    table_lookup(Tables,Key);
  771: 		_Definition ->
  772: 		    %% The element has been deleted, don't look further!
  773: 		    %% Pretend we never saw anything..
  774: 		    {erased,undefined}
  775: 	    end;
  776: 	Answer ->
  777: 	    Answer
  778:     end;
  779: table_lookup(Table, Key) ->
  780:     case ?ets_lookup(Table,Key) of
  781: 	[] ->
  782: 	    {undef,undefined};
  783: 	[{_Key,Value}] ->
  784: 	    {def,{value,Value}}
  785:     end.
  786: 
  787: %%% table_lookup_batch(Tables, Class, Cond) -> KeyList
  788: %%%
  789: %%% Extract the keys from a table or a table group.
  790: %%% If a condition is supplied, it is on the form {Mod, Fun, ExtraArgs}
  791: %%% and returns {true,Key} or false when called using
  792: %%% apply(Mod, Fun, [Instance|ExtraArgs]).
  793: %%% Instance is, for historic reasons, {{Class, Key}, Value} when the function
  794: %%% is called. Cond = 'all' can be used to get all keys from a class.
  795: 
  796: table_lookup_batch([],_Class,_Cond) ->
  797:     [];
  798: table_lookup_batch([Table|Tables],Class,Cond) ->
  799:     table_lookup_batch([],Tables,Table,ets:first(Table),Class,Cond,[]).
  800: 
  801: table_lookup_batch(_Passed,[],_,'$end_of_table',_Class,_Cond,Ack) ->
  802:     Ack;
  803: table_lookup_batch(Passed,[NewTable|Tables],Table,'$end_of_table',
  804: 		   Class,Cond,Ack) ->
  805:     table_lookup_batch(lists:append(Passed,[Table]),Tables,
  806: 		       NewTable,ets:first(NewTable),Class,Cond,Ack);
  807: table_lookup_batch(Passed,Tables,Table,?ERASE_MARK(Key),Class,Cond,Ack) ->
  808:     table_lookup_batch(Passed,Tables,Table,?ets_next(Table,?ERASE_MARK(Key)),
  809: 		       Class,Cond,Ack);
  810: 
  811: table_lookup_batch(Passed,Tables,Table,Key,Class,Cond,Ack) ->
  812:     NewAck =
  813: 	case table_lookup(Passed,Key) of
  814: 	    {undef,undefined} ->
  815: 		[{_Key,Value}] = ?ets_lookup(Table,Key),
  816: 		case Cond of    % are there any conditions?
  817: 		    all ->
  818: 			[Key|Ack];
  819: 		    {M, F, A} ->
  820: 			%% apply the condition test.
  821: 			%% Applications need keys to consist of
  822: 			%% {class, primkey}, so we make it that way
  823: 			case apply(M, F, [{{Class, Key}, Value}|A]) of
  824: 			    {true, Key} -> [Key|Ack];
  825: 			    false ->       Ack
  826: 			end
  827: 		end;
  828: 	    _Other -> 
  829: 		%% Already processed (or erased) key
  830: 		%% {def,{value,Value}} ->
  831: 		%% {erased,undefined} ->
  832: 		Ack
  833: 	end,
  834:     table_lookup_batch(Passed,Tables,Table,?ets_next(Table,Key),
  835: 		       Class,Cond,NewAck).
  836: 
  837: %%% modify(Application, ClassList, Admin) -> ok.
  838: %%%
  839: %%% This function modifies each element of the classes
  840: 
  841: modify(_Application, [], _Admin) ->
  842:     ok;
  843: modify(Application, [Class|Classes], Admin) ->
  844:     ?DEBUG(io:format("modifying class ~p\n", [Class])),
  845:     [{_,Tables}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin, Class),
  846:     modify_class(Application, Class, table_lookup_batch(Tables, Class, all),
  847: 		 Admin),
  848:     modify(Application, Classes, Admin).
  849: 
  850: modify_class(_Application, _Class, [], _Admin) ->
  851:     ok;
  852: modify_class({Mod, Fun, ExtraArgs}, Class, [Key|Keys], Admin) ->
  853:     {ok, {{value, Value}, _Admin}} = handle_lookup(Class, Key, Admin),
  854:     %% The applications think that a key consists of {class, primkey},
  855:     %% so let them.
  856:     case apply(Mod,Fun,[{{Class, Key}, Value}|ExtraArgs]) of
  857: 	{ok,{{NewClass, NewKey}, NewValue}} ->   % The item is modified.
  858: 	    %% remove old instance, insert new
  859: 	    %% JALI could be optimized (we don't care about previous values),
  860: 	    %% but ets_delete/insert is *not* enough
  861: 	    handle_delete(Class, Key, Admin),
  862: 	    handle_insert(NewClass, NewKey, NewValue, Admin);
  863: 	true ->                           % The item should be left as it is.
  864: 	    ok;
  865: 	false ->                          % The item should be removed!
  866: 	    %% JALI could be optimized (we don't care about previous values),
  867: 	    %% but ets_delete is *not* enough
  868: 	    handle_delete(Class, Key, Admin)
  869:     end,
  870:     modify_class({Mod, Fun, ExtraArgs}, Class, Keys, Admin).
  871: 
  872: %%% dump_prepare_classes(Classes,Admin) -> ok
  873: %%%
  874: %%% Create a Ttab for each class, and insert 
  875: %%% the new table order in Admin
  876: 
  877: dump_prepare_classes(Classes,Admin) ->
  878:     ?DEBUG(io:format("DUMP CLASSES ~w\n",[Classes])),
  879:     dump_prepare_classes(Classes,Admin,[]).
  880: 
  881: dump_prepare_classes([],_Admin,Ack) ->
  882:     Ack;
  883: dump_prepare_classes([Class|Classes],Admin,Ack) ->
  884:     [{_Class,[Mtab]}] = ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class),
  885:     %% Only one table => we can prepare for dumping
  886:     %% In case there are several tables defined, dumping is
  887:     %% already (still) in progress for this class (database inconsistent)
  888:     Ttab = make_db_table(db_name(Admin),Class),
  889:     ?ets_insert(Admin,{Class,[Ttab,Mtab]}),
  890:     dump_prepare_classes(Classes,Admin,lists:append(Ack,[{Class,Mtab}])).
  891: 
  892: %%% copy_dump_entry(SourceTable,Key,DestinationTable) -> NobodyCares
  893: %%%
  894: %%% Copies Key from SourceTable to DestinationTable.
  895: %%% If Key is an erase record, then the corresponding entry is deleted
  896: %%% from DestinationTable, if it should be (see Erasure during dump, above)
  897: 
  898: copy_dump_entry(Stab,Key,Dtab) ->
  899:     ?DEBUG(io:format("Copying key ~p\n",[Key])),
  900:     case ?ets_lookup(Stab,Key) of
  901: 	[{?ERASE_MARK(RealKey),_}] ->
  902: 	    %% Only erase if the entry RealKey hasn't been written again
  903: 	    case ?ets_lookup(Stab,RealKey) of
  904: 		[] ->
  905: 		    %% No, it hasn't: we should delete
  906: 		    ?DEBUG(io:format("Erasing: ~p\n",[RealKey])),
  907: 		    ?ets_delete(Dtab,RealKey);
  908: 		_Definition ->
  909: 		    %% It has, don't erase. In this case the new value
  910: 		    %% has already or will soon be written to Dtab
  911: 		    ok
  912: 	    end;
  913: 	[KeyVal] ->
  914: 	    ?DEBUG(io:format("Forwarding: ~p\n",[KeyVal])),
  915: 	    ?ets_insert(Dtab,KeyVal)
  916:     end.
  917: 
  918: %%% DUMP LOADING %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  919: 
  920: load_dump(DbName,DumpDir) ->
  921:     case phys_load_dump_ok(DumpDir) of
  922: 	ok ->
  923: 	    Admin = make_admin_table(DbName),
  924: 	    ?ets_insert(Admin,{?DB_NAME_KEY,DbName}),
  925: 	    case phys_load_table(DumpDir,0,Admin) of
  926: 		ok ->
  927: 		    load_dump2(DumpDir,Admin);
  928: 		Other ->
  929: 		    load_dump_failed(Admin,[]),
  930: 		    {error,{load_dump1,Other}}
  931: 	    end;
  932: 	Other ->
  933: 	    {error,{load_dump2,Other}}
  934:     end.
  935: 
  936: load_dump2(DumpDir,Admin) ->
  937:     case ?ets_lookup(Admin,?LIST_OF_CLASSES_KEY) of
  938: 	[{_Key,Classes}] ->
  939: 	    case load_dump_tables(DumpDir,Admin,Classes) of
  940: 		ok ->
  941: 		    {ok, Admin};
  942: 		Other ->
  943: 		    io:format("Dumping failed: ~p\n",[Other]),
  944: 		    load_dump_failed(Admin,Classes)
  945: 	    end;
  946: 	Other ->
  947: 	    io:format("Dumping failed2: ~p\n",[Other]),
  948: 	    load_dump_failed(Admin,[])
  949:     end.
  950: 
  951: load_dump_failed(Admin,[]) ->
  952:     ?ets_delete(Admin),
  953:     {error,load_dump_failed};
  954: load_dump_failed(Admin,[Class|Classes]) ->
  955:     case ?ets_lookup(Admin,Class) of
  956: 	[{_Key,[Tab]}] ->
  957: 	    ?ets_delete(Tab);
  958: 	_ ->
  959: 	    ok
  960:     end,
  961:     load_dump_failed(Admin,Classes).
  962: 
  963: load_dump_tables(_DumpDir,_Admin,[]) ->
  964:     ok;
  965: load_dump_tables(DumpDir,Admin,[Class|Classes]) ->
  966:     Mtab = make_db_table(db_name(Admin),Class),
  967:     ?ets_insert(Admin,{Class,[Mtab]}),
  968:     Num = length(Classes)+1,
  969:     case phys_load_table(DumpDir,Num,Mtab) of
  970: 	ok ->
  971: 	    load_dump_tables(DumpDir,Admin,Classes);
  972: 	Other ->
  973: 	    {error,{load_dump_failed,Other}}
  974:     end.
  975: 
  976: %%% FILE ACCESS LAYER %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  977: 
  978: %%% phys_init_dump(Class,DumpDir) -> DumpData
  979: 
  980: phys_init_dump(Class,DumpDir,Num) ->
  981:     ?DEBUG(io:format("Opened ~p for writing\n",[Class])),
  982:     FileName = [DumpDir,"/etsdump.",integer_to_list(Num)],
  983:     {tag1,{ok,Fd}} = {tag1,file:open(FileName,write)},
  984:     {Class,Fd}.
  985: 
  986: %%% phys_finish_dump(DumpData) -> NobodyCares
  987: 
  988: phys_finish_dump({_Class,Fd}) ->
  989:     ?DEBUG(io:format("Closed ~p\n",[_Class])),
  990:     phys_dump_term(Fd,ok),
  991:     file:close(Fd), % JALI: OTP P1D returns true instead of ok, so no check
  992:     ok.
  993: 
  994: %%% phys_dump(KeyVal,DumpData) -> NobodyCares
  995: 
  996: phys_dump({Key,Val},{_Class,Fd}) ->
  997:     ?DEBUG(io:format("To disk (~p.dump): {~p,~p}\n",[_Class,Key,Val])),
  998:     phys_dump_term(Fd,{Key,Val}),
  999:     ok.
 1000: 
 1001: phys_dump_term(Fd,Term) ->
 1002:     Bin = binary_to_list(term_to_binary(Term)),
 1003:     {tag2,ok} = {tag2,io:put_chars(Fd,encode32(length(Bin)))},
 1004:     {tag3,ok} = {tag3,io:put_chars(Fd,Bin)}.
 1005: 
 1006: %%% phys_ok_dump(DumpDir) -> NobodyCares
 1007: 
 1008: phys_ok_dump(DumpDir) ->
 1009:     ?DEBUG(io:format("Ok:ing dump dir ~s\n",[DumpDir])),
 1010:     FileName = [DumpDir,"/ok"],
 1011:     {tag4,{ok,Fd}} = {tag4,file:open(FileName,write)},
 1012:     {tag5,ok} = {tag5,io:format(Fd,"ok.\n",[])},
 1013:     file:close(Fd), % JALI: OTP P1D returns true instead of ok, so no check
 1014:     ok.
 1015: 
 1016: phys_remove_ok(DumpDir) ->
 1017:     ?DEBUG(io:format("Removing any Ok in dump dir ~s\n",[DumpDir])),
 1018:     FileName = [DumpDir,"/ok"],
 1019:     %% don't care if delete returns ok, file probably doesn't exist
 1020:     file:delete(FileName),
 1021:     ok.
 1022: 
 1023: phys_load_dump_ok(DumpDir) ->
 1024:     FileName = [DumpDir,"/ok"],
 1025:     case file:consult(FileName) of
 1026: 	{ok,[ok]} ->
 1027: 	    ok;
 1028: 	Other ->
 1029: 	    {error,{consult_error,Other}}
 1030:     end.
 1031: 
 1032: phys_load_table(DumpDir,N,Tab) ->
 1033:     ?DEBUG(io:format("LOAD TABLE ~w\n",[N])),
 1034:     FileName = [DumpDir,"/etsdump.",integer_to_list(N)],
 1035:     case file:open(FileName,read) of
 1036: 	{ok,Fd} ->
 1037: 	    phys_load_entries(Fd,Tab);
 1038: 	Other ->
 1039: 	    {error,{open_error,Other}}
 1040:     end.
 1041: 
 1042: phys_load_entries(Fd,Tab) ->
 1043:     case phys_read_len(Fd) of
 1044: 	{ok,Len} ->
 1045: 	    case phys_read_entry(Fd,Len) of
 1046: 		{ok,ok} ->
 1047: 		    ok;
 1048: 		{ok,{Key,Val}} ->
 1049: 		    ?ets_insert(Tab,{Key,Val}),
 1050: 		    phys_load_entries(Fd,Tab);
 1051: 		Other ->
 1052: 		    {error,{read_len,Other}}
 1053: 	    end;
 1054: 	Other ->
 1055: 	    {error,{read_len2,Other}}
 1056:     end.
 1057: 
 1058: phys_read_len(Fd) ->
 1059:     case io:get_chars(Fd,'',4) of
 1060: 	[A,B,C,D] ->
 1061: 	    {ok,decode32(A,B,C,D)};
 1062: 	Other ->
 1063: 	    {error,{decode,Other}}
 1064:     end.
 1065: 
 1066: phys_read_entry(Fd,Len) ->
 1067:     case io:get_chars(Fd,'',Len) of
 1068: 	L when is_list(L), length(L) == Len ->
 1069: 	    {ok,binary_to_term(list_to_binary(L))};
 1070: 	Other ->
 1071: 	    {error,{read_term,Other}}
 1072:     end.
 1073: 
 1074: encode32(N) ->
 1075:     [(N bsr 24) band 255, 
 1076:      (N bsr 16) band 255, 
 1077:      (N bsr 8) band 255,
 1078:      N band 255].
 1079: 
 1080: decode32(A,B,C,D) ->
 1081:     (A bsl 24) bor (B bsl 16) bor (C bsl 8) bor D.
 1082:
